ccre.cluck

Class CluckNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.cluck.CluckNode

  • public class CluckNode
extends java.lang.Object
    A CluckNode is the core hub of the Cluck networking system on a device. It handles message routing, publishing, and subscribing. Usually the main instance of this is kept in CluckGlobals.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      CHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> aliases
      A map of alias names to what they alias for.

      Should this CluckNode log all messages as they pass through? (For debugging)

      An estimated total of how many bytes have gone through this node, if the messages were serialized through CluckProtocol.

      A map of the current link names to the CluckLinks.

      • rmtToString

        public static java.lang.String rmtToString(int type)
        Convert an RMT ID to a string.
        Parameters:
        type - The RMT_* message ID.
        Returns:
        The version representing the name of the message type.

      • notifyNetworkModified

        public void notifyNetworkModified()
        Notify everyone on the network that the network structure has been modified - for example, when a connection is opened or closed.

      • transmit

        public void transmit(java.lang.String target,
            java.lang.String source,
            byte[] data)
        Transmit a message to the specified other link (relative to this node), with the specified return address (relative to this node). Paths are /-separated, with each element being a link to follow.
        Parameters:
        target - The target path.
        source - The source path.
        data - The message data to transmit.

      • transmit

        public void transmit(java.lang.String target,
            java.lang.String source,
            byte[] data,
            CluckLink denyLink)
        Transmit a message to the specified other link (relative to this node), with the specified return address (relative to this node). If this is a broadcast, then don't include the specified link (to prevent infinite loops). Paths are /-separated, with each element being a link to follow.
        Parameters:
        target - The target path.
        source - The source path.
        data - The message data to transmit.
        denyLink - The link for broadcasts to not follow.

      • addAlias

        public void addAlias(java.lang.String from,
            java.lang.String to)
        Add a network alias from the specified link name to the specified path. For example: node.addAlias("crio", "central/robot/crio"); In this example, a message sent to crio/enabled would be equivalent to it being sent to central/robot/crio/enabled Source paths will not be modified.
        Parameters:
        from - The target to alias.
        to - The path to alias it to.

      • startSearchRemotes

        public void startSearchRemotes(java.lang.String localRecv,
                      CluckRemoteListener listener)
        Set up the specified CluckRemoteListener to start receiving updates about what remote nodes are broadcasting their availability. After this is set up, use cycleSearchRemotes to recheck for more remote nodes.
        Parameters:
        localRecv - The local link name for the listener. Should be unique.
        listener - The listener to notify with all found remotes.
        See Also:
        cycleSearchRemotes(java.lang.String)

      • cycleSearchRemotes

        public void cycleSearchRemotes(java.lang.String localRecv)
        Recheck for remote nodes, as in startSearchRemotes.
        Parameters:
        localRecv - The local receiving address, which must be the same as the one passed to startSearchRemotes originally.
        See Also:
        startSearchRemotes(java.lang.String, ccre.cluck.CluckRemoteListener)

      • searchRemotes

        public java.lang.String[] searchRemotes(java.lang.Integer remoteType,
                               int timeout)
                                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Get a snapshot of the list of remote nodes of the specified remote type (or null for all types).
        Parameters:
        remoteType - The remote type to search for, or null for all types.
        timeout - How long to wait for responses.
        Returns:
        The snapshot of remotes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

                        LogLevel minimum)

        the LoggingTarget.
